org.mapdb

Class DB

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mapdb.DB

  • public class DB
extends Object
    A database with easy access to named maps and other collections.
    Author:
    Jan Kotek

    • Method Detail

      • getHashMap

        public <K,V> ConcurrentMap<K,V> getHashMap(String name)
        Opens existing or creates new Hash Tree Map. This collection perform well under concurrent access. Is best for large keys and large values.
        Type Parameters:
        K - key
        V - value
        Parameters:
        name - of map
        Returns:
        map

      • createHashMap

        public <K,V> ConcurrentMap<K,V> createHashMap(String name,
                                     Serializer<K> keySerializer,
                                     Serializer<V> valueSerializer)

      • getHashSet

        public <K> Set<K> getHashSet(String name)
        Opens existing or creates new Hash Tree Set.
        Type Parameters:
        K - values in set
        Parameters:
        name - of Set
        Returns:
        set

      • createHashSet

        public <K> Set<K> createHashSet(String name,
                       Serializer<K> serializer)

      • getTreeMap

        public <K,V> ConcurrentNavigableMap<K,V> getTreeMap(String name)
        Opens existing or creates new B-linked-tree Map. This collection performs well under concurrent access. Only trade-off are deletes, which causes tree fragmentation. It is ordered and best suited for small keys and values.
        Type Parameters:
        K - key
        V - value
        Parameters:
        name - of map
        Returns:
        map

      • createTreeMap

        public <K,V> ConcurrentNavigableMap<K,V> createTreeMap(String name,
                                              int nodeSize,
                                              boolean valuesStoredOutsideNodes,
                                              Serializer<K[]> keySerializer,
                                              Serializer<V> valueSerializer,
                                              Comparator<K> comparator)

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes database. All other methods will throw 'IllegalAccessError' after this method was called.

        !! it is necessary to call this method before JVM exits!!
